Question: On his death, this person settled an annuity on Ternan which made her a financially independent woman.
Hints: Charles John Huffam **** (pron.: /?t??rlz ?d?k?nz/; 7 February 1812 – 9 June 1870) was an English writer and social critic.
This person became very attached to Mary, and she died in his arms after a brief illness in 1837.
The only first-class carriage to remain on the track was the one in which this person was travelling.
